required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Lacosamide 200 mg Twice a Day (Bid) on Single Dose Warfarin 25 mg in Healthy Males
clinical_study.official_title: Single-center, Open-label, Randomized 2-way Crossover Study of the Effect of Lacosamide 200 mg Twice Daily on the Single-dose Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Warfarin (25 mg) in Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of Lacosamide 200 mg twice a day (bid) on single dose pharmacokinetics (PK) and pharmacodynamics (PD) of Warfarin (25 mg) in healthy male volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the Warfarin plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 to infinity, AUC (Warfarin)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple sampling from 0 -168 hours following administration of a single Warfarin dose in each treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the Warfarin plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 to the last quantifiable level, AUC0-t(Warfarin)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple sampling from 0 -168 hours following administration of a single warfarin dose in each treatment period
Multiple sampling from 0 -168 hours following administration of a single Warfarin dose in each treatment period
Multiple sampling from 0 -168 hours following administration of a single warfarin dose in each treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Warfarin area under the prothrombin time (PT) versus time curve (PTAUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple sampling from 0 -168 hours following administration of a single warfarin dose in each treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Warfarin area under the International Normalized Ratio (INR) versus time curve (INRAUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple sampling from 0 -168 hours following administration of a single Warfarin dose in each treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Lacosamide trough plasma concentration (Ctrough)

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of at Least One Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) during the duration of the study

arm_group.arm_group_label: Single dose of Warfarin on day 3
arm_group.description: Single dose of Warfarin on day 3 of a 7 day course of Lacosamide 200 mg BID

intervention.description: Strength: 200 mg, Form: Tablet, Frequency: Twice daily, Duration: 9 days
intervention.arm_group_label: Single dose of Warfarin on day 3

intervention.description: Strength: 5 mg, Form: Tablet, Frequency: 1 single dose in each period In total, during the two periods, each healthy volunteer will receive 2 single doses 3 weeks apart. Duration: single dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male volunteers 18-55 years of age
- BMI 18.0-30.0 kg/m2 and weight at least 50 kg
- Tympanic body temperature 35.0-37.5Â°C (95 and 99.5Â°F) inclusive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Volunteer has participated or is participating in any other clinical studies of investigational drug or another Investigational Medicinal Product (IMP) within the last 3 months
- Volunteer is not healthy (eg, taking any drug treatments, excessive amount of alcohol, cigarettes or caffeine, having any medical or emotional/psychological problems, a drug/alcohol abuse, having abnormal safety parameters)
- Volunteer is taking Warfarin or Non Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID)
- Volunteer has history of suicide attempt
- Volunteer has history of coagulation abnormalities, occult blood in stool, gastrointestinal ulcer, surgery within 6 months
